intro: Crocodilodes amplexicaulis, commonly known as the clasping crocodile plant, is a striking member of the Gesneriaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its thick, fleshy stems and vibrant, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from red to orange. Its leaves are often clasping, wrapping around the stem, giving it a unique appearance. It thrives in bright, indirect light and requires consistent moisture to flourish.
